info.title: Standard Dashboard Configuration
info.description: Schema for Chronosphere's standard dashboard configuration

auto.description: Whether to include the the auto option

auto_min_interval.description: The minimum interval to use when auto is enabled

color.description: Valid colors are hex, rgb, rgba, hsl, hsla

line_style.description: Valid styles are Solid and Dashed

limit.description: Maximum number of bars to display in the chart, defaults to 25 when not specified.

min.description: value associated with the lower end of the color scale (defaults to 0)

max.description: value associated with the upper end of the color scale (defaults to max value in the data set)

hideZeros.description: if true, leave 0-value / missing-value / negative-value cells empty

colorPalette.description: The kind of color palette to use. Categorical means we use just cycle through the color based on the series index. Consistent means we assign color by the series name and attempt to assign the same color across panels.

color.description: Valid colors are hex, rgb, rgba, hsl, hsla

line_style.description: Valid styles are Solid and Dashed

color_palette.description: The kind of color palette to use. Categorical means we use just cycle through the color based on the series index. Consistent means we assign color by the series name and attempt to assign the same color across panels.

expression.description: A math expression that references other queries, e.g. (a / b) * 100

group_by.description: Determines how the events are grouped
